documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: Advanced Virtualization bug fix and enhancement update

note.text: The updated Advanced Virtualization module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 Advanced Virtualization.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The Advanced Virtualization module provides the user-space component for running virtual machines that use KVM in environments managed by Red Hat products.

Users of Advanced Virtualization are advised to upgrade to this updated module, which fixes a number of bugs and adds various enhancements.

note.text: A flaw was found in the way the libvirtd daemon issued the 'suspend' command to a QEMU guest-agent running inside a guest, where it holds a monitor job while issuing the 'suspend' command to a guest-agent. A malicious guest-agent may use this flaw to block the libvirt daemon indefinitely, resulting in a denial of service.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1809740: CVE-2019-20485 libvirt: Potential DoS by holding a monitor job while querying QEMU guest-agent

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Eric Blake (Red Hat Inc.).
